perturbation.original_text:
3.5.1    Payments due shall be made within 45 days of the
                           close of each calendar quarter.
                  3.5.2    Payments that are not received within thirty (30)
                           days after their due date will bear interest at the
                           rate of twelve percent (12.0%) per annum compounded
                           monthly from the due date until such payment is
                           received.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.5.1    Payments due shall be made within 45 days of the
                           close of each calendar quarter.
                  3.5.2    Payments that are not received within sixty (60)
                           days after their due date will bear interest at the
                           rate of twelve percent (12.0%) per annum compounded
                           monthly from the due date until such payment is
                           received.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that late payments will accrue interest after 30 days past the due date. The modified text changes this to 60 days. Section 3.5.1 states that payments are due within 45 days of the quarter's end. The amended Section 3.5.2 implies interest accrues only after 60 days beyond the due date (45 days), effectively giving a 105-day grace period before interest applies. This creates a contradiction and enforcement uncertainty: Is interest triggered after 30 days post due date, or 60 days post due date?
